intro: Maerlensia, commonly known as the sea fennel, is a marine plant belonging to the family Zosteraceae. It is characterized by its dense, branching structure composed of calcium carbonate-based filaments. Maerlensia thrives in shallow, temperate coastal waters, often forming underwater meadows. Its unique morphology provides habitat and shelter for various marine organisms. This plant plays a crucial role in coastal ecosystems by stabilizing sediments and supporting biodiversity.
